title: Lukas-Guillotine
author: Lukas-Guillotine
content: Hello guys,sorry but Ebang site is not supporting miners anymore. Not possible to download...We need any of the related files below:- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.20.tar.gz- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.20.binThe name is "E9.3 Firmware version number: Firmware –9.0.0.20"- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.21.tar.gz- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.21.binThe name is "E9.3 Firmware version number: Firmware –9.0.0.21"Those are Ebang E9.3 Firmware. Cant get if from anywhere. The only place is megaminer which has 9.0.0.23 which is too recent (cant update the machine).https://megaminer.net/download/asic/ebang-firmware-download/Anyone please upload it, really appriciate your help!

comments.author: kpin404
comments.body: Quote from: Lukas-Guillotine on October 11, 2022, 03:21:48 PMHello guys,sorry but Ebang site is not supporting miners anymore. Not possible to download...We need any of the related files below:- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.20.tar.gz- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.20.binThe name is "E9.3 Firmware version number: Firmware –9.0.0.20"- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.21.tar.gz- http://miner.ebang.com.cn/upload/miner/cms/btc_upgrade_9.0.0.21.binThe name is "E9.3 Firmware version number: Firmware –9.0.0.21"Those are Ebang E9.3 Firmware. Cant get if from anywhere. The only place is megaminer which has 9.0.0.23 which is too recent (cant update the machine).https://megaminer.net/download/asic/ebang-firmware-download/Anyone please upload it, really appriciate your help! I have the same firmware upgrade issue with my Ebang Ebit E9.3 miner. I have tried to upgrade the miner with your mentioned firmware version 9.0.0.23, but it didn't work at all.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.created_time: October 31, 2022, 11:59:03 PMLast edit: November 01, 2022, 12:14:53 AM by Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: This sucks. It all looks as though their miner part of the website is down. Worse still, not GitHub to retrieve the older releases from.I checked out their main site, maybe you can give it a shot by writing to their supportGeneral Inquiriesinfo@ebang.comProducts Inquiriesproducts@ebang.comEdit: from the archived version of the site (https://web.archive.org/web/20210618215111/http://miner.ebang.com.cn/article-13.html) I managed to salvage this;E-mail：ebit@ebang.com.cnskype:live:ivy_1434skype:lynnnesnayskype:tammyni03Your best option right now is their support

comments.author: kpin404
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on October 31, 2022, 11:59:03 PMThis sucks. It all looks as though their miner part of the website is down. Worse still, not GitHub to retrieve the older releases from.I checked out their main site, maybe you can give it a shot by writing to their supportGeneral Inquiriesinfo@ebang.comProducts Inquiriesproducts@ebang.comEdit: from the archived version of the site (https://web.archive.org/web/20210618215111/http://miner.ebang.com.cn/article-13.html) I managed to salvage this;E-mail：ebit@ebang.com.cnskype:live:ivy_1434skype:lynnnesnayskype:tammyni03Your best option right now is their supportI have already been mailed and skype to all of them on the same communication contacts quite long time before as per provided by you, but sorry to say that these guys didn't respond back at all ever. This really sucks. If you have got any response from them please let me know. Thanks.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I tried to search but I couldn't find other sources to download them I have a list of that firmware before in Google Drive as I bookmarked but I formatted my PC which is why I can't retrieve my links.Would you mind checking the control board for the exact model and CPU name we will try to search it through that keyword?Let's see if can still retrieve them or find another source.

comments.author: kpin404
comments.created_time: November 02, 2022, 12:28:30 PMLast edit: November 02, 2022, 12:46:27 PM by kpin404
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on November 01, 2022, 11:55:27 PMI tried to search but I couldn't find other sources to download them I have a list of that firmware before in Google Drive as I bookmarked but I formatted my PC which is why I can't retrieve my links.Would you mind checking the control board for the exact model and CPU name we will try to search it through that keyword?Let's see if can still retrieve them or find another source.Thank you for keep helping. I really appreciated. Below is the control board image link to be revived by you for further help in searching of firmware for this. Thanks.https://i.ibb.co/Kb6DL1J/IMG-20221102-171756.jpg

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: kpin404 on November 02, 2022, 12:28:30 PMThank you for keep helping. I really appreciated. Below is the control board image link to be revived by you for further help in searching of firmware for this. Thanks.https://i.ibb.co/Kb6DL1J/IMG-20221102-171756.jpgSorry to say but I cant  find any firmware for this control board. Even my old links for zynq CPUs are no longer available.What exactly the current status of your miner? Why did you want it to upgrade it?If its not working due to firmware issue your last hope is to replace the control board.

comments.author: kpin404
comments.body: QuoteSorry to say but I cant  find any firmware for this control board. Even my old links for zynq CPUs are no longer available.Its Okay! No problem at all.QuoteWhat exactly the current status of your miner? Why did you want it to upgrade it?Its keeps restarting again and again once start. Sometimes shows quite high temperature and sometimes keeps the hash rate zero while everything connected okay. And sometime works good without any issue. So i think upgrading the firmware could fix the issue.   QuoteIf its not working due to firmware issue your last hope is to replace the control board.I am not sure whether its firmware issue or power supply issue as power supply is normal.  Thanks.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: kpin404 on November 03, 2022, 01:22:50 PMI am not sure whether its firmware issue or power supply issue as power supply is normal.  Thanks. I can't say if it's a firmware issue but it is more likely a PSU issue.Can you still access the WebGUI or dashboard?If you can still access through the miner's IP would you mind checking the API logs or any logs that contain your miner's activity logs? Maybe we can find the issue under that logs?Post the logs here don't forget to put it inside the code tag a # button you can find it while editing your post.Also, I would like you to try is to hard reset the miner by holding the IP or reset button for 15 to 20 seconds then release.Set up the miner again then test.

comments.author: kpin404
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on November 03, 2022, 02:40:48 PMQuote from: kpin404 on November 03, 2022, 01:22:50 PMI am not sure whether its firmware issue or power supply issue as power supply is normal.  Thanks. I can't say if it's a firmware issue but it is more likely a PSU issue.Can you still access the WebGUI or dashboard?If you can still access through the miner's IP would you mind checking the API logs or any logs that contain your miner's activity logs? Maybe we can find the issue under that logs?Post the logs here don't forget to put it inside the code tag a # button you can find it while editing your post.Also, I would like you to try is to hard reset the miner by holding the IP or reset button for 15 to 20 seconds then release.Set up the miner again then test.Actually, I have opened the miner for its servicing like to fix burnt power supply cables and dust cleaning and adding the heat sink silicon flux/paste to hash boards' heat sinks, once assembled and run back the miner I'll update you with the same. Thanks for keep helping.
